title: Air Force opens own investigation into secret documents leak
description: The Air Force has opened its own probe into the secret documents disclosure and says the accused leaker’s unit is no longer carrying out its intelligence mission.

title: Aaron Carter drowned, autopsy report reveals
description: Aaron Carter's cause of death has been ruled a drowning, according to a report from the Los Angeles County Coroner.

title: Parking garage partially collapses in NYC, killing 1
description: Mayor Eric Adams says one person has been killed in the partial collapse of a parking garage in lower Manhattan’s Financial District

title: Pregnant woman killed after teens allegedly fire at her car by mistake
description: A pregnant woman was fatally shot in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, after a group of teens allegedly fired at her car in an apparent case of mistaken identity, police said.

title: 4 found dead at home, 3 shot on interstate in connected incidents
description: Three drivers were shot on a Maine interstate on Tuesday shortly after four people were found dead in a nearby home in what police are calling connected incidents.

title: Indiana Senate approves handgun training fund for teachers
description: Indiana state Senators have advanced a bill that would make state funding available for teachers seeking firearm training, a move critics say could increase the number of guns in school to the detriment of students

title: Former NFL defensive end Chris Smith dead at 31
description: Chris Smith was touched by tragedy while he played for the Cleveland Browns.

title: These state lawmakers just passed a near-total abortion ban
description: The North Dakota House Monday passed a near-total abortion ban with exceptions for the mother's life as well as rape or incest, but only up to six weeks' gestation.

title: Russia excluded from men's basketball at 2024 Olympics
description: Basketball’s international governing body FIBA says Russia has been excluded from qualification for the men’s Olympic basketball tournament in Paris next year

title: Ben & Jerry's supports Vermont workers' unionization drive
description: Vermont ice cream maker Ben & Jerry’s says it supports a plan to unionize by the workers at a retail shop in the same city where the brand was founded

title: 2 Iowa teens plead guilty in Spanish teacher's beating death
description: Two Iowa teenagers charged in the beating death of a high school teacher have pleaded guilty to first-degree murder

title: Buffalo Bills' Damar Hamlin fully cleared for football activities
description: Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin has been fully cleared for football activities.

title: Freelancers can prepare now for new 2023 tax reporting
description: If you receive payments via apps like Venmo, Zelle, Cash App or PayPal, your tax reporting requirements will change next year

title: Gun safety demonstrators carry caskets to Tennessee Capitol
description: Protesters calling for gun safety legislation were blocked from bringing caskets inside Tennessee’s Capitol, but a recently reinstated legislator escorted an infant-sized casket inside before he was barred from carrying it onto the House floor

title: Former Oklahoma detainee sues jail after claims she suffered severe facial burns
description: An Oklahoma woman has filed a federal lawsuit alleging she suffered severe facial burns while in custody at the Oklahoma County Detention Center in 2021.

title: New Jersey wins Supreme Court dispute against New York
description: The Supreme Court says New Jersey can withdraw from a commission the state created decades ago with New York to combat the mob’s influence at their joint port

title: 21 dead in Beijing hospital fire, dozens evacuated
description: Chinese state media say 21 people have died in a fire at a Beijing hospital that forced the evacuation of dozens of patients

title: China calls US accusations of police stations 'groundless'
description: China has denied all accusations of an overseas police presence, saying the United States was making “groundless accusations” after U.S. law enforcement arrested two men in New York for establishing a secret police station

title: Dominion-Fox News live updates: Jury selection underway in defamation trial
description: The voting company has sued Fox for $1.6 billion over false election claims.

title: Man charged with murder in shooting of 20-year-old woman who went up wrong driveway
description: A man has been charged with murder after he allegedly shot and killed a young woman who was in a car that mistakenly pulled into his driveway in rural upstate New York.

title: Thousands join Holocaust remembrance march at Auschwitz
description: Thousands of people have gathered at the former site of Auschwitz for the March of the Living

title: Biden signs executive order to improve access to child care
description: President Joe Biden has signed an executive order containing more than 50 directives to increase access to child care and improve the work life of caregivers

title: Wall Street Journal reporter arrested in Russia expected in court Tuesday
description: Evan Gershkovich, a Moscow correspondent with the Wall Street Journal who has been charged as a spy in Russia, is expected to be in a Moscow court on Tuesday.

title: Putin visits Russian troops in occupied Ukraine
description: The Kremlin says Russian President Vladimir Putin has visited headquarters of the Russian troops fighting in Ukraine

title: Russian court to hear jailed US reporter's appeal
description: A Russian court is scheduled to hear a defense appeal of Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich’s arrest on espionage charges which he and the U.S. government strenuously deny

title: Putin visits Russian troops in occupied Ukraine
description: The Kremlin says Russian President Vladimir Putin has visited headquarters of the Russian troops fighting in Ukraine

title: Massive landslide buries trucks in northwest Pakistan
description: Officials say a massive landslide triggered by lightning amid rain has struck a key highway near the Torkham border town in northwestern Pakistan, burying several trucks and injuring some people

title: Rat ambassadors try to counter bad press amid NYC's rat war
description: As an ambassador for rats, it’s never easy to win over the public

title: Blinken confirms US diplomatic convoy was fired on in Sudan
Supreme Court hears mail carrier's religious tolerance case
description: The Supreme Court is being asked to decide under what circumstances businesses must accommodate the needs of religious employees

title: LA mayor wants $1.3B for homeless crisis, hotels for housing
description: Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass is recommending the city spend what she called a record $1.3 billion next year to get homeless people into housing

title: Court throws out Berkeley, California's ban on natural gas
description: A federal appeals court has overturned Berkeley, California’s first-in-the-nation ban on natural gas in new construction, agreeing with restaurant owners who argued the city bypassed federal energy regulations when it approved the ordinance

title: 17 men arrested in California Sikh community shootings
description: Authorities in Northern California have arrested more than a dozen people they say are responsible for a series of shootings within the Sikh community

title: 2nd teen charged in kidnapping migrants in Houston
description: Authorities say a second teenager has been charged with kidnapping several migrants and allegedly holding them captive for several days at a Houston hotel before they were rescued by FBI agents during a confrontation that ended with the fatal shooting ...
